dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1336 IH: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide States with flexibility in providing choice of coverage through managed care under Medicaid.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cramer (for himself and Mr. Mullin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide States with flexibility in providing choice of coverage through managed care under Medicaid.

section.header: State flexibility to provide choice of coverage in managed care
section.text: Paragraph (3) of section 1932(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396uâ€“2(a)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: A State may, at its option, permit an individual to choose a managed care entity from two or more such entities that meet the applicable requirements of this section, and of section 1903(m) or section 1905(t).
